title: Why do many people have an username like this?
body:
|I|I|I|I|I|I|

I swear i see them every week

replies.body: Nobody can look them up on op.gg.
Except for you look yourself up and then just click on them.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iz7hbpr0,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-04T19:19:38.317+0000)
>
> Nobody can look them up on op.gg.

Click "live game" done.

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iz7hbpr0,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-04T19:19:38.317+0000)
>
> Nobody can look them up on op.gg.

Reminds me of this one time I saw someone with a car plate as something along the lines B88BB8 making it 'harder' to report to the police if he/she speeds or something

> [{quoted}](name=MagicFlyingLlama,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iz7hbpr0,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-08-04T19:19:38.317+0000)
>
> Nobody can look them up on op.gg.

yes they can, just copy their name from champ select, or snipe yourself and redirect to them from live/match history.

It's like a barcode username or something, as it's supposed to look similar to a barcode. Essentially like someone already pointed out, it's pretty much so people can't look them up, although that's kinda irrelevant now as you can just go to your profile and look at live game, or just use one of the many apps out there that tell you their stats once you get into loading screen.

Why do many people ask me If my name is a reference to Tokyo Ghoul? I know why, but just find it annoying that everyone ask that.

The username is from a random nickname generator website, It just happened to sound like Ken Kaneki...
Is your name a reference to tokyo ghoul

> [{quoted}](name=Aatrox Airlines,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=iz7hbpr0,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2019-08-05T12:32:28.388+0000)
>
> Is your name a reference to tokyo ghoul

No, I was searching for new username years ago and decided to look up on username generator websites. Kenneky was the name I liked the most from all I picked, before that I never knew of Tokyo Ghoul, nor the character...
Did literally anyone ask about your name?
its because people used to use this in starcraft so people wouldn't know who they are and couldn't abuse holes in their strategy, in league of legends? its pointless and just for wannabe kids.

Before League it was used in Starcraft and other similar games to avoid players knowing who their opponent was, in order to get an advantage. In league this is exclusively useful for streamers. Ghosting is much harder if you can't find their name, other players that do it may be playing a mental game that maybe they are a challenger smurf, or a challenged smurf (if you know what I mean.)
I've seen 2 people/the same person twice with a name that is just a random amount of centimters and kilograms.
